Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Fc-SWD (A single whey acidic protein domain-containing peptide, natural AMPs; Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide most resembles (75.4% similarity)shrimp SWDPm2.  note that MIC50 was measured: Active against G+ bacteria S. aureus ATCC 6538 (MIC 0.67 uM), S. agalactiae CUCC 1886 (MIC 0.88 uM), B. subtilis ATCC 9372 (MIC50 0.83 uM), M. luteus ATCC 4698 (MIC50 6.65 uM), G- bacteria E. coli 8099 (MIC 1.66 uM), K. peneumoniae CMCC(B) 46102 (MIC 6.65 uM), fungi C. albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 3.51 uM), V. dahliae (MIC 16.2 uM), F. oxysporum f.sp.vasinfectum (MIC 16.2 uM), F. graminearum (MIC50 5.4 uM), F. solani (MIC 10.8 uM), G. cingulata (MIC 10.8 uM), and C. orbiculare (MIC 10.8 uM).Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: the mature peptide has been expressed and purified. Updated 7/2021; 6/2023
Literature Information.Author: Jia Y, Sun Y, Wang Z, Wang, Q., Wang, X., Zhao, X., and Wang, J. 2008
Literature Information.Title: A single whey acidic protein domain (SWD)-containing peptide from fleshy prawn with antimicrobial and proteinase inhibitory activities
